DataElement.preferredDefinition: Amount of oral contrast ingested measured and recorded in ml.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Substances used in radiography that allow visualization of certain tissues taken into the body by mouth.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Oral; of, or relating to, or affecting, or for use in the mouth.:Substances used in radiography that allow visualization of certain tissues.

Concepts.definition: Of, or relating to, or affecting, or for use in the mouth.

Substances administered during imaging procedures that allows delineation of internal structures. Contrast agents appear opaque due to the difference in absorption of X-rays or other electromagnetic waves and surrounding tissue.

Property.preferredDefinition: Taking into the body by mouth.

Concepts.definition: The act of taking food, medicines, and other substances into the body by mouth.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

DataElementConcept.origin: ACRIN:American College of Radiology Imaging Network
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 7/5/17 Per Round 5 finalization, new DEC 5829897 created to superceded this DEC.  10/13/13 Removed caBIG-ACRIN CSI; added equivalent ECOG-ACRIN CSI. jc  7/1/13 changed context to ECOG-ACRIN.  jc 12/28/09 released for VCU FLT 8029 study.  12/28/07- Created to support curation of ACRIN PET CDEs

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Amount of a substances administered during diagnostic procedures that allows delineation of internal structures.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Substances used in radiography that allow visualization of certain tissues.:To determine the number or amount of something; the result of this activity.

Concepts.definition: Substances administered during imaging procedures that allows delineation of internal structures. Contrast agents appear opaque due to the difference in absorption of X-rays or other electromagnetic waves and surrounding tissue.
Determining the number or amount of something.

ValueDomain.origin: ACRIN:American College of Radiology Imaging Network
ValueDomain.changeDescription: 10/14/13 Removed caBIG-ACRIN CSI; added equivalent PET modality CSI. jc  7/26/13 removed "manually-curated" from definition. 12/28/09 released for VCU FLT 8029 study.  12/31/07  created for ACRIN PET curation

DataElement.origin: ACRIN:American College of Radiology Imaging Network
DataElement.changeDescription: 9/25/13 - removed ref to CT Imaging Agent CSI; required larger numeric.  Superceded with CDE 3908103. jc 7/2/13 associated with CT Imaging Agent CRF CSI. jc  12/28/09 released for VCU FLT 8029 study.  1/3/08- Created to support curation of ACRIN PET CDEs
